content: This Italian astronomer, mathematician, and physicist played a major role in the scientific revolution and is often called the "father of modern science."

You're referring to Galileo Galilei. He was indeed a pivotal figure during the Renaissance, making significant contributions to the fields of astronomy, mathematics, and physics. His support for heliocentrism—the idea that the Earth and other planets revolve around the Sun—was controversial during his time but has since become the accepted model of our solar system. Galileo's work laid the groundwork for the scientific method and had a profound impact on the development of modern science.
